details.value:
FMF Cape Breton (FMF CB) is the West Coast Royal Canadian Navy (RCN) maintenance facility, servicing all West Coast RCN ships and submarines.

FMF CB has an engineering section (ENG), providing engineering support in the repair, maintenance, and operation of RCN units both in home-port and wherever they are deployed throughout the world.

Within FMF CB ENG there is a Combat Systems Engineering (CSE) section that deals with communications, command and control, weapons and sensor systems (both above and underwater).

As an integral member of the CSE team, you will assist in various aspects of engineering/engineering management in the field of Combat Systems Engineering. Specifically this co-op position deals with surveillance systems - radars, electronic warfare, command and control, and data link.

Typical activities in which you will participate include:

Assist in development of a troubleshooting manuals for various shipborne combat systems interface/systems.
Assist Surveillance Systems staff with the conduct of radar, electronic warfare, command and control and data link systems trials
alongside/in harbour
Research, Catalogue and review the Combat Systems Trials Requirements Database

You will be working with various sections within the unit, including personnel from the Business, Production, other Engineering Departments and/or other units within CFB Esquimalt.

You will be required to present your work term report to members of the FMF CAPE BRETON senior management team.
